ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the vast and intricate background behind Brazilian identity.
I learned a lot about the culture and history of Brazil! I really enjoyed the different artists and writers we learned about as well as reading their works!
I learned plenty about Brazils history and literature and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class should be taught as a seminar.
David is a great professor and a really nice guy but I do wish the course was more of a seminar style since it was such a small group.
This course was great. The readings were very interesting and the discussions always fun. I liked how the readings were organized by week.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, a great compliment to Portuguese.
I would recommend this whole program!
Yes! Brazil is fascinating and full of such a complex and rich history.
